intro: Gnaphalium imbaburense, commonly known as the Babarua or Babarua grass, is a flowering plant native to the grasslands of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and other composite flowers. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats and is often found in disturbed soils. Gnaphalium imbaburense is adapted to arid conditions and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native environment.
